recommendations: Shannon Sorrels
NA ACES L&D Manager
CS Management
January 12, 2015, Eric was a client of Shannon’s

Shannon is a unique person in the fitness business.  She combines science, compassion, bluntness, and a clear understanding of human nature to provide the most successful weight loss program I have ever witnessed. Customer after customer, including myself, not only looses weight to get to healthy levels, but a large number keep it off.  Recently I have had the opportunity to work with her on some team-building and fitness actives for my company. Shannon's corporate experience really helped her understand our unique culture and develop a program that was in our budget and far exceeded our goals.  I never thought I would be fit again, let alone run a half marathon. I also never thought I would get my introverted engineering employees in a parking lot wearing colored team shirts participating in a fitness competition, and with smiles on their faces.  Shannon made both happen.On top of everything, she is also a smart and funny person that is a pleasure to spend time with, even if she is pushing you past where you thought your limits were.

Chandra Sekaran
Manager, Consulting Services: Enabling customers realize value from simulation driven product development
January 12, 2015, Eric worked with Chandra but at different companies

I've been working closely with Chandra for over a decade, maybe more.  He has always shown a great ability to balance the needs of customers, sales, and development finding win-win-win solutions.  He shows that rare combination of strong technical knowledge, great communication skills, and strong business sense.  As the product portfolio he works with has grown, Chandra has shown a great ability to learn new technologies and most importantly, how customers gain value from their application.  Often the voice of reason on conference calls, Chandra has great management and communication skills as well. On top of all of that, he is a pleasure to spend time with.

summary: Business Owner - Engineer - ANSYS Fan Boy - 3D Printer - Writer/Speaker - Angel Investor - Marketing/HR/IT/OperationsI'm lucky enough to be able to do what I love every day.  At PADT "We Make Innovation Work" by helping companies that make physical products by providing them the engineering services and tools they need. Everyday I get to work with smart employees, interesting customers, and fantastic vendors.Those are the basic facts, read on to learn more...The official bio:  Eric Miller is a co-owner of Tempe based PADT, Inc., where he is involved in providing tools and services to companies who design and manufacture physical products.  He holds a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from the University of California, Berkeley and has lived in Arizona since 1986.  He started his career focusing on the application of Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and Computer Aided Design (CAD) to simulate turbine engine components.  Over the years he became recognized as an expert user of the ANSYS software tool and in the development of custom software to automate the product simulation and design process. As a co-founder of PADT in 1994, Eric was able to also pursue his interests in IT, graphic design, additive manufacturing, database programming, and small business management.  As both PADT and the use of advanced engineering tools grew, Eric became exposed to dozens of different industries and developed his broad understanding of the application of technology for product development and manufacturing.After over three decades in the industry, Eric is often called upon to write and speak on simulation, design, and 3D Printing as well as on startups and the high-tech sector.  His involvement in the startup community includes angel investing as well as mentoring and serving on steering, screening, and advisory boards of a variety of technical organizations and institutions.  In his spare time Eric enjoys traveling, history, cooking, running, and learning about new things.
name: Eric Miller
title: Co-Owner and Principal, PADT
